Opcode.name: PCM_OP_CUST_COMMIT_CUSTOMER
Opcode.Doc: The PCM_OP_CUST_COMMIT_CUSTOMER opcode creates an active customer, with requested services. This opcode will also purchase deals and charge the credit card if necessary. Upon failure, validation errors may be returned.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: POID of the chosen plan.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Plan level flags. This may be used to pass plan customization flag PIN_PLAN_FLG_ON_DEMAND to force on demand billing.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_TXN_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Transaction flags. This flag is used when account needs to be created using a Global Transaction. Default value is 1 which means opcode opens its own transaction. When set to 2 it supports global transaction.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_VERSION
Int.Doc: The version flag indicates if the flist confers to the current specification or legacy specification. The values could be PIN_PORTAL_VERSION_CURRENT or PIN_PORTAL_VERSION_LEGACY. If legacy is specified a conversion function will be invoked. Default is legacy.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_DEAL_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Account level deal to purchase (if any).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_ACCTINFO
Array.Doc: Information to be stored in the account object will be passed in the acctinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: Partial poid of account object to be created.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_DEAL_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Account level deal to purchase (if any).

Substruct.name: PIN_FLD_DEAL_INFO
Substruct.Doc: Deal to be purchased at account level. The DEAL_INFO and PIN_FLD_DEAL_OBJ are mutually exclusive. Sometimes we may purchase the deal customized. So, the DEAL_INFO has the entire deal object (the products and discounts in the deal should be passed) in the PIN_FLD_DEAL_INFO sub-structure.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name of the deal object. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Deal description. This is a free text to describe product. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Valid start time. Defines valid period for the deal object (inclusive). Stored as desired time in server timezone. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Valid end time. Defines valid period for the deal object (non-inclusive). Stored as desired time in server timezone. If end time is zero, valid period does not expire. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Flag to indicate on demand bill at the deal level and has value PIN_DEAL_FLG_BILL_ON_DEMAND for on demand billing. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PRODUCTS
Array.Doc: Products Array. Array of products to purchase for the deal. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PRODUCT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Poid of the product to purchase.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_QUANTITY
Decimal.Doc: Quantity to purchase.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc:
Status of this subscription product. Possible values are
NOT_SET(0)
ACTIVE(1)
INACTIVE(2)
CANCELLED(3)

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that product activates (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, the start_unit will be -1. The start date can be specified in relative units, if it is not set for first usage. The values can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage start, the start_offset will be 0 and relative offset can be specified for purchase if first usage option is not marked. To be used in conjunction with unit to calculate purchase_start_t with reference to the event time.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that product expires (0 means that product does not expire).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative Unit for Purchase can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Purchase to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate purchase end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Purchase discount. The percentage discount applied to purchase/cancel rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISC_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed amount discount for purchase fees amount of discount applied to purchase/cancel rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_FEE_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Purchase fee to be applied for this product. Amount specified here will override the price specified in the /rate object.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that cycle fees begin for this product (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, the start_unit will be -1. The start date can be specified in relative units if it is not set for first usage. The values can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage start, the start_offset will be 0 and relative offset can be specified for cycle if first usage option is not marked. To be used in conjunction with unit to calculate cycle_start_t with reference to the event time.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that cycle fees are no longer applied for this product (0 means always applied).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative Unit for Cycle can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Cycle to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate cycle end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Cycle fee discount. The percent discount applied to cycle rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISC_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed amount discount applied to cycle rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_FEE_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Cycle fee (both forward and arrears) to be applied for this product. Amount specified here will override the price specified in the /rate object.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that usage fees begin for this product (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, this field is -1. Otherwise the start date is a relative offset, with the unit specified in this field as:
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage, this field is 0. Otherwise, the start date is a relative offset, which is specified by a combination of this field and the start unit field.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee end time. Number ofseconds into the future relative to purchase time that usage fees are no longer applied for this product (0 means always applied).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative unit for Usage can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for usage to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate usage end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Usage fee discount. The percent discount applied to usage rates of product.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Description on a per product basis for CSR to add comments.

String.name: PIN_FLD_PRICE_LIST_NAME
String.Doc: Price list name associated with this offering.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DISCOUNTS
Array.Doc: Discounts Array. Array of discounts to purchase for the deal. Element-id is not significant. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_DISCOUNT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Poid of discount to purchase.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_QUANTITY
Decimal.Doc: Quantity to purchase.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc:
Status of this subscription discount. Possible values are
NOT_SET(0)
ACTIVE(1)
INACTIVE(2)
CANCELLED(3)

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that discount activates.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, the start_unit will be -1. The start date can be specified in relative units if it is not set for first usage. The values can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage start, the start_offset will be 0 and relative offset can be specified for purchase, if first usage option is not marked. To be used in conjunction with unit to calculate purchase_start_t with reference to the event time.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that discount expires (0 means that discount does not expire).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative Unit for Purchase can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Purchase to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate purchase end_t.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that cycle fees begin for this discount (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, the start_unit will be -1. The start date can be specified in relative units if it is not set for first usage. The values can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage start, the start_offset will be 0 and relative offset can be specified for purchase, if first usage option is not marked. To be used in conjunction with unit to calculate cycle_start_t with reference to the event time.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that cycle fees are no longer applied for this discount (0 means always applied).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative unit for Cycle can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Cycle to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate Cycle end_t.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that usage fees begin for this discount (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, this field is -1. Otherwise the start date is a relative offset, with the unit specified in this field as:
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage, this field is 0. Otherwise, the start date is a relative offset, which is specified by a combination of this field and the start unit field.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that usage fees are no longer applied for this discount (0 means always applied).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative unit for Usage can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Usage to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate Usage end_t on First Usage.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Description on a per discount basis for CSR to add comments.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PERMITTEDS
Array.Doc: Permitted array. Contains type strings for account and service object types that are permitted to purchase this deal. Each entry is implicitly appended with a wildcard for checking, so account and service types that were inherited from a permitted type are also permitted themselves. No entries implies any account or service type is permitted to purchase the deal. Element-id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_OBJ_TYPE
String.Doc: Object type - identifies an allowed account or service object type.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: Account level balance group indicator. Here the array does not contain anything but the element-id is significant. It indicates which balance group element in the input is account level. It is recommended to pass in the PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO. If not passed then a default balance group will be created.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Accounting type of the account. This field is moved under PIN_FLD_BILLINFO array. If this field is still passed under PIN_FLD_ACCTINFO array, it will be copied to all PIN_FLD_BILLINFO arrays and dropped from ACCTINFO. This backward compatibility support is provided only if PIN_FLD_VERSION is legacy. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO already defines this field, the value passed here is ignored and dropped.

Values.Doc: This represents "open items" type of accounting. With open item accounting customer's bill does not include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS).
This represents "balance forward" type of accounting. With balance forward accounting customer's bill will include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD).

String.name: PIN_FLD_GL_SEGMENT
String.Doc: Account's General Ledger segment. Used in G/L reporting.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY
Int.Doc: The primary currency of the account. Also this acts as element-id of primary balance element for accounting roll-up. If not provided the default account currency information will be read from CM's pin.conf.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY_SECONDARY
Int.Doc: The secondary currency of the account. Also this acts as element-id of secondary balance element for accounting roll-up.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of account. This can be either a brand account, a subscription account or a standard account.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BUSINESS_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the business type of account. The valid values for this field will be either PIN_BUSINESS_TYPE_CONSUMER(1) or PIN_BUSINESS_TYPE_BUSINESS(2).

Values.Doc: Indicates that the customer is of type consumer (PIN_BUSINESS_TYPE_CONSUMER).
Indicates that the customer is of type business (PIN_BUSINESS_TYPE_BUSINESS).

String.name: PIN_FLD_CUSTOMER_SEGMENT_LIST
String.Doc: Customer Segment List - a string list of customer segments separated by '|'. Example: For segments 1, 4, 6 the string is "1|4|6".

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_ACCESS
String.Doc: Client identification fields. Access method - admin, meccad, etc.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_SOURCE
String.Doc: Source address - ANI, X121, IP addr, etc.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_VENDOR
String.Doc: ID String for client software vendor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_PROMO_CODE
String.Doc: Promotional code for client package - generally set by vendor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_SERIAL_NUM
String.Doc: Serial number for specific copy of client.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: This field represents the timestamp at which the event ends. Effective time of the update to this account, on an external system. If this field is not specified, then current time on the BRM server will be considered.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: This would be the timestamp to be used to generate events. If not specified, the current time on the BRM server will be considered. In case of backdated operations, this field should be passed with the value same as PIN_FLD_END_T.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_STATUSES
Array.Doc: Desired Status Info. If not specified, and active account is created. The element-id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Desired status of the account. The possible values of this field would be PIN_STATUS_ACTIVE(10100), PIN_STATUS_INACTIVE(10102)or PIN_STATUS_CLOSED(10103).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Desired status flags. This indicates a reason for the account to become inactive or closed.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CLOSE_WHEN_T
Timestamp.Doc: Desired account close time.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The Balance Group array. List of balance groups that need to be created. If not specified, at least one balance group will be created by default during account creation.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The partial poid of the balance group to be created. During monitor creation/update, Poid type of /balance_group/monitor is used.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: The billinfo array element. Here the contents are not significant. The element id will determine the billinfo that will be associated with this balance group. if not specified then the first billinfo that the system finds will be associated with this balance group.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The POID of Billinfo that this balance group will be associated with. The fields PIN_FLD_BILLINFO and PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ are mutually exclusive. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO is available then PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ will be ignored.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_LIMIT
Array.Doc: This an optional array to set the credit limit parameters. The element id is significant and indicates the resource id for which the limit is being set.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_LIMIT
Decimal.Doc: Limit for this resource. Current balance cannot exceed this limit unless affected by a limit override rate or manually adjusted by a CSR.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_FLOOR
Decimal.Doc: Baseline for calculating percentage for threshold triggers. Credit limit minus credit floor is 100% of measured range. Credit floor does NOT enforce any limit on current balance.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_THRESHOLDS_FIXED
Decimal.Doc: Limit for this resource. Current balance cannot exceed this limit unless affected by a limit override rate or manually adjusted by a CSR.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_THRESHOLDS
Int.Doc: Bit flags for triggering when resource balance crosses a boundary when increasing in value.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_THRESHOLDS
Array.Doc: Array of fixed threshold values.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_THRESHOLD
Int.Doc: Fixed threshold value.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_AMOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed threshold value in Decimal data type

Array.name: PIN_FLD_RULES
Array.Doc: This is an optional array to set the consumption rules for a resource. The element id is significant and indicates a resource id for which the limit as well as consumption rules are set.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_CONSUMPTION_RULE
Enum.Doc: Consumption rule to be applied on the resource.

Values.Doc: The consumption rule is not defined (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_UNDEFINED).
Earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest validity start time (earliest valid_from) first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EST).
Latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest validity start time (latest valid_from) first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LST).
Earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance that expires first (earliest valid_to.)(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EET)
Latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance that expires last (latest valid_to.)(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LET)

Earliest start time and latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the latest valid_to first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_ESTLET).

Earliest start time and earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the earliest valid_to first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_ESTEET).

Latest start time and earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest sub-balance first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the earliest expired sub-balance first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LSTEET).

Latest start time and latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the latest valid_to first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LSTLET).

Earliest expiration time and earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, consume the one with the earliest valid_from first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EETEST).

Earliest expiration time and latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, consume the one with the latest valid_from first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EETLST).

Latest expiration time and earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, use the one with the earliest valid_from first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LETEST).

Latest expiration time and latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, use the one with the latest valid_from first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LETLST).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: This represents the array of Billing info's. If not provided a default billinfo will be created. The element id is significant as it behaves as a key, in other objects like balance groups (bal_info array) to be created during account creation, to identify which billinfo element to associate with.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The type only billinfo poid.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BUSINESS_PROFILE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Business profile poid. Pointer to the Business profile poid to which this billinfo belongs.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_ID
String.Doc: This field identifies the billinfo by name.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: The Payinfo array. The element-id is significant, but not the contents. The element-id will be used to identify which payinfo array to use from the input. If it is not present then the payment method is considered either as transient or voucher.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The balance group info array. The element-id is significant, but not the contents. The element-id will be used to identify which balance group array to use from the input. If it is not present then a default balance group will be created for the billinfo.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAY_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of billing for user.

Values.Doc: Indicates charge roll up to parent account(PIN_PAY_TYPE_SUBORD).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT_FLAGS
Int.Doc: This flag indicates if this billinfo has subordinates or not. A value of 0 indicates no subordinates and a value of 1 indicates that it has subordinates.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_BILL_WHEN
Int.Doc: Anniversary billing slot.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_FUTURE_DOM
Int.Doc: New Accounting Close day-of-month (1-31).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Accounting type of the billinfo. Possible values are PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS(1) and PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD(2).This field is used to allocate items for payment. If not specified, the configuration entry actg_type is read from pin.conf of CM. If CM's pin.conf does not have actg_type entry active, then default accounting type will be balance forward type.

Values.Doc: This represents "open items" type of accounting. With open item accounting customer's bill does not include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS).
This represents "balance forward" type of accounting. With balance forward accounting customer's bill will include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Indicates whether the billinfo should be billed or it should be suspended for billing.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Indicates a reason for setting of the given billing status.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Status of the billinfo: active, inactive, or closed.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Indicates a reason for setting of the given status.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SPONSOR_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates whether this billinfo has a sponsoree.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SPONSOREE_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates whether this billinfo has a sponsor.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_AR_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: It indicates the AR billinfo for the given billinfo. It can be present only for a subodinate billinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: It indicates the immediate (one level up) parent. Note that the given billinfo is not necessarily a subordinate. The parent field may reflect just child-parent relation. It should be mandatory if moving to the new parent.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY
Int.Doc: During account creation these values will be derived from the account. In future when an account can have multiple currencies, the value specified here will be used.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY_SECONDARY
Int.Doc: During account creation these values will be derived from the account. In future when an account can have multiple currencies, the value specified here will be used.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_SEGMENT
Enum.Doc: It indicates the Billing Segment. A billing segment is a user defined category such as wholesale or retail, that controls the accounting DOMs to which a bill unit can be assigned.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: Array of payment methods to be associated with this account. At least one payinfo array is required for creating an account.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The partial poid of payinfo.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAY_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of billing for user.

Values.Doc: Indicates charge roll up to parent account(PIN_PAY_TYPE_SUBORD).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAYMENT_TERM
Enum.Doc: Payment term ID defines which payment term will be used in the payment due date calculation.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PAYMENT_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Payment offset value.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_INV_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Indicates the type of invoice to be generated.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Partial Flag. This enables the opcode to treat some fields from the input flist as optional. Values are (0) mandatory, or (1) optional. The fields affected are: PIN_FLD_DEBIT_NUM, PIN_FLD_DEBIT_EXP, PIN_FLD_BANK_NO, PIN_FLD_CITY, PIN_FLD_STATE, PIN_FLD_ZIP and PIN_FLD_COUNTRY.

Substruct.name: PIN_FLD_INHERITED_INFO
Substruct.Doc: All subclass fields for the payinfo object are included in this substruct. The subclass depends on the pay_type. If pay_type is invoice then this array element will have PIN_FLD_INV_INFO, etc.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_INV_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to invoice type of payment menthod. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_DELIVERY_PREFER
Enum.Doc: Prefered delivery method email(0), postal(1) and fax(3).

String.name: PIN_FLD_INV_INSTR
String.Doc: Comments to appear on each invoice.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_INV_TERMS
Enum.Doc: Used for invoice terms to be printed on the invoice.

String.name: PIN_FLD_EMAIL_ADDR
String.Doc: Email address to which invoice be delivered.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name of party responsible for payment.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_CC_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to credit card type of payment menthod. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name as it appears on the credit card.

String.name: PIN_FLD_SECURITY_ID
String.Doc: Security ID. Used for credit card fraud prevention. This field stores the 3 digit CVV2 for Visa and 4 digit CID for amex.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DD_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to direct debit type of payment menthod. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BANK_NO
String.Doc: RDFI/Bank ID used for routing transactions.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name as it appears on the card.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Bank account type. Checking(1), savings(2) or corporate(3).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_SEPA_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to SEPA type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Mandate type whether it is one-off or recurring.

String.name: PIN_FLD_IBAN
String.Doc: International Bank Account Number which is a unique identifier for the bank account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BIC
String.Doc: Bank Identifier Code which is a unique identifier for the bank related to the account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_CONTRACT_ID
String.Doc: ID of the underlying contract between the debtor and the creditor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_CONTRACT_DESCR
String.Doc: Description of the underlying contract between the debtor and the creditor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_UNIQUE_REFERENCE
String.Doc: A unique reference number for the mandate.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_SIGNED_T
Timestamp.Doc: Date when the mandate is signed. This cannot be before the account creation date or a future date.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_SIGNED_PLACE
String.Doc: Place where the mandate is signed.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DEBTOR_INFO
Array.Doc: Array to store SEPA compliant customer's bank account details.

String.name: PIN_FLD_REF_PARTY
String.Doc: Name of the Debtor Reference Party.

String.name: PIN_FLD_REF_PARTY_ID_CODE
String.Doc: Identification code of the Debtor Reference Party.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_NAMEINFO
Array.Doc: This is name and address information. The element-id of the element defines the contact type for some predefined values. The element id of 1 indicates Billing Contact. Other values are undefined, and the contact_type string describes the type of contact.

String.name: PIN_FLD_CONTACT_TYPE
String.Doc: Contact type comment for this person (for undefined element-ids).

String.name: PIN_FLD_GEOCODE
String.Doc: Geocode of the address used for taxation(for billing address).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PHONES
Array.Doc: Phone array.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Phone Type. The possible values are unknown(0),home(1), work(2), fax(3), pager(4), portable(5), POP(6), Support(7).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_LOCALES
Array.Doc: There can only be one element in this array. The element id must be 1.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_SERVICES
Array.Doc: This represents services array.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_SERVICE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Partial poid of service object to create. The 'type' and 'database' sub-fields are used in the creation. The other sub-fields are ignored.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SUBSCRIPTION_INDEX
Int.Doc: If this is a member service of a line/subscription, the index points to the parent/subscription service of the line. The member service object, when created, will refer the parent/subscription service using the SUBSCRIPTION_OBJ field. For all other services, the default is 0. If SUBSCRIPTION_OBJ is type-only, then this field is mandatory.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_SUBSCRIPTION_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Subscription service object. If this field is type-only, then SUBSCRIPTION_IDEX field will point to the SERVICES array element, that would be actual subscription service. This is an optional field, and it refers to the subscription service object of which this service is a member of.

String.name: PIN_FLD_SERVICE_ID
String.Doc: User defined name for the service. This identifies the service uniquely within the plan

Array.name: PIN_FLD_SERVICE_CODES
Array.Doc: The array aliases.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: Balance Group array which this service instance is associated to. The element-id is significant not the contents of the array. The element-id will be used to identify which balance group array to use from the input to associate the service to. if not specified the service will be associated with the account level balance group.

String.name: PIN_FLD_LOGIN
String.Doc: Login for service object. It is optional for telco and GSM services, mandatory for email and ip services.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_ALIAS_LIST
Array.Doc: The array aliases.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PASSWD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Desired password status. The possible values are NORMAL(0), TEMP(1), EXPIRES(2) and INVALID(3).

Values.Doc: The password status is valid and normal (PIN_SERV_PASSWDSTATUS_NORMAL).
The password status is valid and is temporary (PIN_SERV_PASSWDSTATUS_TEMPORARY).

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_DEAL_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Deal that service object purchased (if any). This is for backward compatibility for the Plan not having PIN_FLD_DEALS array.

Substruct.name: PIN_FLD_DEAL_INFO
Substruct.Doc: Deal to be purchased at service level. The DEAL_INFO and PIN_FLD_DEAL_OBJ are mutually exclusive. Sometimes we may purchase the deal customized. So, the DEAL_INFO has the entire deal object (the products and discounts in the deal should be passed) in the PIN_FLD_DEAL_INFO sub-structure.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: POID of the chosen deal.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name of the object. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Deal description. This is a free text to describe product. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Valid start time. Defines valid period for the deal object (inclusive). Stored as desired time in server timezone. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Valid end time. Defines valid period for the deal object (non-inclusive). Stored as desired time in server timezone. If end time is zero, valid period does not expire. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Flag to indicate on demand bill at the deal level and has value PIN_DEAL_FLG_BILL_ON_DEMAND for on demand billing. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PRODUCTS
Array.Doc: Products Array. Array of products to purchase for the deal. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PRODUCT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Poid of the product to purchase.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_QUANTITY
Decimal.Doc: Quantity to purchase.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc:
Status of this subscription product. Possible values are
NOT_SET(0)
ACTIVE(1)
INACTIVE(2)
CANCELLED(3)

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that product activates (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, the start_unit will be -1. The start date can be specified in relative units, if it is not set for first usage. The values can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage start, the start_offset will be 0 and relative offset can be specified for purchase if first usage option is not marked. To be used in conjunction with unit to calculate purchase_start_t with reference to the event time.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that product expires (0 means that product does not expire).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative Unit for Purchase can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Purchase to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate purchase end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Purchase discount. The percentage discount applied to purchase/cancel rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISC_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed amount discount for purchase fees amount of discount applied to purchase/cancel rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_FEE_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Purchase fee to be applied for this product. Amount specified here will override the price specified in the /rate object.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that cycle fees begin for this product (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, the start_unit will be -1. The start date can be specified in relative units if it is not set for first usage. The values can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage start, the start_offset will be 0 and relative offset can be specified for cycle if first usage option is not marked. To be used in conjunction with unit to calculate cycle_start_t with reference to the event time.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee end time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that cycle fees are no longer applied for this product (0 means always applied).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative Unit for Cycle can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Cycle to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate cycle end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Cycle fee discount. The percent discount applied to cycle rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISC_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed amount discount applied to cycle rates of product.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_FEE_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Cycle fee (both forward and arrears) to be applied for this product. Amount specified here will override the price specified in the /rate object.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee start time. Number of seconds into the future relative to purchase time that usage fees begin for this product (0 means immediately).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_UNIT
Int.Doc:
For first usage start, this field is -1. Otherwise the start date is a relative offset, with the unit specified in this field as:
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_OFFSET
Int.Doc: For first usage, this field is 0. Otherwise, the start date is a relative offset, which is specified by a combination of this field and the start unit field.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee end time. Number ofseconds into the future relative to purchase time that usage fees are no longer applied for this product (0 means always applied).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc:
Relative unit for Usage can be
Seconds(1)
Minutes(2)
Hours(3)
Days(4)
Months(5)
Act Cycles(8)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for usage to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate usage end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Usage fee discount. The percent discount applied to usage rates of product.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Description on a per product basis for CSR to add comments.

String.name: PIN_FLD_PRICE_LIST_NAME
String.Doc: Price list name associated with this offering.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DISCOUNTS
Array.Doc: Discounts Array. Array of discounts to purchase for the deal. Element-id is not significant. Present only if a customized deal is to be purchased.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PERMITTEDS
Array.Doc: Permitted array. Contains type strings for account and service object types that are permitted to purchase this deal. Each entry is implicitly appended with a wildcard for checking, so account and service types that were inherited from a permitted type are also permitted themselves. No entries implies any account or service type is permitted to purchase the deal. Element-id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_OBJ_TYPE
String.Doc: Object type - identifies an allowed account or service object type.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DEALS
Array.Doc: This is the array of deals that this service purchases.
